intro: Memecylon kurzii, commonly known as the Himalayan memecylon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South and Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have four to five petals, with yellowish or white hues.
